models.background: Your origin story — the path from engineering to product.
models.experience: Places you've worked with stories structured as Context → Insight → Reasoning → Action → Impact.

background.title: Journey
points:
AI Product Manager with a CS background from IIT Jammu.
Built products 0 to 1, ran discovery, wrote PRDs, shipped.

15% engagement lift. 30% productivity gain. 25% less manual work. 4x faster response times.
These aren't just metrics — they're problems I found and solved.

Hands-on with RAG, LLMs, and workflow systems.
I sit at the intersection of product thinking and technical depth.

items.description: Built foundations in systems thinking, algorithms, and first-principles problem-solving.
First formal PM role. Designed AI chatbot, ran discovery, wrote PRDs, managed stakeholders.

stories.context: First-time buyers in UAE were abandoning the mortgage journey early.
stories.insight: They weren't confused about mortgages — they hadn't decided whether to buy at all.
stories.reasoning: The product was solving the wrong problem. We needed to address the upstream decision blocker.
stories.action: Designed AskRivo, an AI chatbot that walks users through the rent vs buy tradeoff before pushing products.
stories.impact: Addressed the real decision blocker upstream, improving early-stage engagement.

stories.context: Mortgage specialists were managing leads through WhatsApp and Excel with zero visibility.
stories.insight: Nobody knew where deals were stalling. Four critical handoff gaps existed in the workflow.
stories.reasoning: PRDs should target the gaps first, then sequence releases to avoid overloading the team.
stories.action: Ran discovery sessions, mapped end-to-end workflows. Wrote PRDs for gaps. Set phased roadmap: visibility → reliability → productivity → AI.
stories.impact: Created structured pipeline visibility for the first time.

stories.context: Faced timeline pressure from stakeholders pushing for more features.
stories.insight: Only core flow items would directly impact lead conversion.
stories.reasoning: More features ≠ more value. Shipping essentials on time beats shipping everything late.
stories.action: Cut scope to essentials. Pushed back on non-critical requests.
stories.impact: Shipped on time without compromising functionality specialists actually needed.

items.description: Entrepreneurial pivot from engineering to product. Built with RAG, agents, and eval loops.

stories.context: Started building another system design content library.
stories.insight: Talked to 20+ engineers. The problem wasn't content access — nobody was giving them feedback on their answers.
stories.reasoning: Feedback loops would be the moat content could never replicate.
stories.action: Pivoted the entire product around evaluation instead of information.
stories.impact: Session recordings confirmed users were returning for feedback, not content.

stories.context: Needed to ship fast with limited resources.
stories.insight: Every component had a build vs buy decision that would affect velocity.
stories.reasoning: Made explicit tradeoffs: RAG for retrieval (build), agents for practice (build), eval loops for feedback (build).
stories.action: Built the core system. Acquired 50+ users through direct outreach.
stories.impact: Validated product-market fit with real usage data.

items.tagline: B2B SaaS point of sale platform
items.description: Built features that directly impacted merchant productivity and retention.

stories.context: Retail clients were juggling employee schedules in spreadsheets alongside the POS.
stories.insight: Scheduling wasn't a separate problem — it was directly tied to register staffing and sales coverage.
stories.reasoning: Integrating scheduling into POS would give managers one source of truth.
stories.action: Proposed and built a Shift Management module that integrated scheduling into the POS.

stories.context: Clients wanted differentiation but had limited dev resources for custom features.
stories.insight: Round-up charity donations at checkout are low-lift but create real emotional impact.
stories.reasoning: No complex loyalty programs needed. Simple feature, outsized emotional return.
stories.action: Pitched Charity Checkout to leadership, owned the UX, shipped it.
stories.impact: Merchants who enabled it saw 25% more repeat purchases.

items.tagline: B2B SaaS for AI-powered landscaping takeoffs
items.description: Shipped proposal engine, aligned cross-functional teams, mentored engineers.

stories.context: Contractors were spending hours manually assembling proposals after AI-generated takeoffs.
stories.insight: We were stopping at takeoff data when the real value was packaging output for their clients.
stories.reasoning: API integrations would let us ship the full workflow, not just the data.
stories.action: Worked with PM to prioritize integrations. Drove technical decisions. Shipped proposal engine.
stories.impact: 25% reduction in contractor manual work. Became a key selling point.

stories.context: Engineering, design, and sales were building independent mental models of the product.
stories.insight: Misalignment wasn't malicious — nobody was explicitly syncing assumptions.
stories.reasoning: Lightweight weekly syncs would surface gaps before they caused rework.
stories.action: Mentored 4 engineers. Instituted weekly cross-functional syncs.
stories.impact: Sales started selling what we were actually building.

items.tagline: Wellness platform for personalized fitness and nutrition
items.description: Improved retention and performance through data-driven problem solving.

stories.context: Retention was dropping but nobody had pinpointed where.
stories.insight: The drop-off was concentrated in onboarding. Users were bouncing before experiencing the core value prop.
stories.reasoning: Getting users to first coach interaction faster would prove value before churn.
stories.action: Redesigned the onboarding flow to accelerate time-to-first-value.

stories.context: Response times were slow, users complained, cloud costs climbed.
stories.insight: The bottleneck wasn't code quality — it was database queries and caching misses.
stories.reasoning: Redis caching and MySQL partitioning would give 80% of gains with 20% of effort.
stories.action: Led optimization initiative with PM and infra team.
stories.impact: 4x faster response times. 10% cloud cost reduction.
